alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Delaware; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 22 at 10:11PM CDT until September 23 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT SATURDAY FOR NORTHWESTERN LINN, SOUTHEASTERN BUCHANAN AND SOUTHWESTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 1011 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Thunderstorms moving into southern Buchanan County will produce additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Center Point, Central City, Walker, Coggon, Quasqueton, Troy Mills, Paris, Monti, Robinson, Buffalo Creek Park, Pinicon Ridge Park and Linn County Fairgrounds. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 36 and 39. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
